fig = plt.figure()

# bar plot

ax1 = fig.add_axes([0,0,1,1])
ax1.bar(df.keys(), df.values(), edgecolor = '0')

# plot title & labels

ax1.set_title('Bar Plot', y = 1.05, fontsize = 18)
ax1.set_xlabel('blood type', fontsize = 15)
ax1.set_ylabel('counts', fontsize = 15)


# pie plot

ax2 = fig.add_axes([1.2,0,1,1])
ax2.pie(df.values(),explode = (0.1,0.1,0.1,0.1), labels = df.keys(),
        labeldistance = 1.03, shadow = True, autopct = '%1.1f%%', 
        startangle = -90, radius = 1.15, rotatelabels = True,
        textprops = {'fontsize': 12})

# plot title

ax2.set_title('Pie Plot', y = 1.05, fontsize = 18)



plt.show()

# data
# 300 samples, mean = 170, std = 10

while True :
    p = np.random.normal(170,10,300)
    if (170<np.mean(p)<170.1) & (10<np.std(p)<10.1):
        break

print(np.std(p))
print(np.mean(p))

# Now we have our data with acceptable tolerance in mean and std
